p: Prior studies suggest that climate-health awareness has increased in the Caribbean over time. Earlier studies found that there was limited knowledge about climate and health linkages amongst nurses and doctors in private and public sectors [ 41]. More recent studies in the Caribbean confirm a relatively high level of awareness and concern amongst health-care providers [ 40], similar to studies in the U.S. [ 35, 37]. Several capacity building initiatives undertaken by regional health institutions have likely contributed to higher levels of climate-health awareness over time.
